page.title: 10THE VILLAGE OF DRIFFIELD
page.content: In many ways Driffield is a typical Cotswold village. The population has declined over the years ( there are now 113 on the Parish electoral roll),due largely to the mechanisation of farming. However, there are now more houses, and the people living in the village all seemed very pleased to be there. It is an attractive, well kept village, with a beautiful Manor House, owned by Mr. Michael Ingram. Some years ago, the land farmed as Manor Farm, was sold to its present owners, Messrs. Henly, Swettenham, and Ford.The old school is now a private dwelling, as for some time there have not been sufficient village children to justify keeping a school open. These changes in the pattern of life in a village, from a busy agricultural community,to a beautiful,sleepy back water are familiar in the Cotswolds.
